skills.name: Identify unit fractions when part of a shape
Divide proper fractions in the form: Fraction ÷ Integer
Divide proper fractions in the form: Integer ÷ Fraction

explanations.A: 1 means 1 whole. What fraction is the question mark pointing to?
explanations.B: The ? is a fifth of the shaded section, but how much is it of the whole?
explanations.C: The whole bar is split into 6 equal pieces. The question mark represents 1 piece. Therefore it is 1/6 of the whole.
explanations.D: 5/6 is just less than 1, but 6/5 is bigger than 1. Is this section bigger than 5/6?

explanations.A: 4/5 is just less than 1, but 5/4 is bigger than 1. Is this section bigger than 4/5?
explanations.B: The whole bar is split into 5 equal pieces. The question mark represents 1 piece. Therefore it is 1/5 of the whole.
explanations.C: The ? is a quarter of the shaded section, but how much is it of the whole?
explanations.D: 1 means 1 whole. What fraction is the question mark pointing to?

explanations.A: I think you may have multiplied. Does dividing by 2 make something bigger or smaller?
explanations.B: It looks like you divided 2 by 1/5 instead of the other way around.
explanations.C: ÷ 2 is the same as ✕ 1/2, then we multiply the numerators and the denominators.
explanations.D: Sometimes we "flip" the fraction we're dividing by then multiply, but we don't flip the number to be divided.

explanations.A: Sometimes we "flip" a fraction we're dividing by, but we don't flip a number to be divided.
explanations.B: ÷ 3 is the same as ✕ 1/3, then we multiply the numerators and the denominators.
explanations.C: It looks like you divided 3 by 1/6 instead of the other way around.
explanations.D: I think you may have multiplied. Does dividing by 3 make something bigger or smaller?

explanations.A: I think you may have multiplied. 2 ÷ 1/5 means how many times does 1/5 fit into 2?
explanations.C: Sometimes we "flip" a fraction we're dividing by, but we don't flip a number to be divided.
explanations.D: Sometimes we "flip" a fraction we're dividing by, but we don't also flip a number to be divided.

explanations.A: I think you may have multiplied. 3 ÷ 1/6 means how many times does 1/6 fit into 3?
explanations.B: Sometimes we "flip" a fraction we're dividing by, but we don't flip a number to be divided.
explanations.C: Sometimes we "flip" a fraction we're dividing by, but we don't also flip a number to be divided.

explanations.A: I think you may have multiplied. Does dividing by 3 make something bigger or smaller?
explanations.B: Sometimes we "flip" a fraction we're dividing by, but we don't flip a number to be divided.
explanations.D: It looks like you've multiplied top and bottom by 3, which gives an equivalent fraction.

explanations.B: It looks like you've multiplied top and bottom by 4, which gives an equivalent fraction.
explanations.C: I think you may have multiplied. Does dividing by 4 make something bigger or smaller?
explanations.D: Sometimes we "flip" a fraction we're dividing by, but we don't flip a number to be divided.

explanations.A: 45/75 simplifies to 3/5, so this is an equivalent fraction. What operation do you think the question needs?
explanations.B: 1/5 would fit 75 times into 15, but we're asking about 3/5.
explanations.C: It looks like you've multiplied the numbers. What operation do you think the question needs?

explanations.A: It looks like you've multiplied the numbers. What operation do you think the question needs?
explanations.C: 36/48 simplifies to 3/4, so this is an equivalent fraction. What operation do you think the question needs?
explanations.D: 1/4 would fit 48 times into 12, but we're asking about 3/4.
